website_summaries.verdict: These heavy-duty elbow length gardening gloves are tough enough to work with roses and other thorny plants.
pros: Made from thick synthetic leather with spandex backing to improve comfort and fit
Padded, puncture-resistant palm and reinforced fingertips for added protection
cons: Users report gloves run small, so it's best to size up

customer_reviews.title: I do love that they come up to my elbows so I ...
customer_reviews.text: These worked really well in helping me chop back my raspberry plant, only one thorn prick made it through the gloves. They fit well and aren't uncomfortable, I do love that they come up to my elbows so I can reach into the plant without harm. However, I was pretty annoyed that they put a industrial staple right through the gloves.
customer_reviews.author: vivi

customer_reviews.title: run a bit small, but they are nice gloves!
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful! They do seem to run a tad bit small so be careful on the size that you order. I happened to have ordered the Medium because they wanted $12 more for the small - I wasn't going to pay almost double for a smaller size, so I went with the mediums. I'm glad that I did because the mediums fit nicely where I usually wear a small.
customer_reviews.author: CMac -Amazon Addict!

customer_reviews.title: The fit of these gloves is terrible ... unuseable.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves seemed ideal to protect my wrist and arms while pruning holly bushes and weeding around other prickly plants. I ordered Medium, which I use in all latex, winter and gardening gloves. Tried on these gloves and thumb was two times longer than needed and the finger lengths were too short! DO NOT PURCHASE THESE GLOVES.
customer_reviews.author: IMGumbyD

customer_reviews.title: The best garden gloves ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair I've bought. The first pair, the middle right hand fingertip came unstitched. I have several rose bushes and wild blackberry vines to tend to, and these gloves are sturdy, protect my arms to my elbows and protect my hands from scratches, dirt and more. I wear them every time I am in the yard, mowing, weeding, trimming, pruning, planting, etc. I wouldn't be without them.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly J. Cowling

customer_reviews.title: Love These Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great for working outside. Since they aren't plastic or rubber your hands don't get sweaty or uncomfortable in warm weather. These are heavy suede and they breathe. These are the only type of gloves I will wear to work outdoors here in the southern midwest. They are long enough to protect from scratches from branches, and poison ivy, on your forearms. I used to be able to buy a similar style from a big box store, but are no longer carried there. I am happy with these, and they last about a year for me - and that's says they are very durable. This will be the third year, and third pair I am purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC, Hand Saving Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love these gloves!! I have a horrible, sticker vine (berry) that grows rampant thru my pretty ground cover in my yard. Every once in a while I have to brave it and go in to try to pull it out...again! These stickers hurt and cling to your clothes and your arms. These gloves are fantastic!! I recently hired someone to do this nasty job for me, since I had let it go way too long. At the end of the day he asked me where I had purchased these gloves. He said, "I would be so torn up without them." I will buy another pair, love them!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Cardoni

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Thorn Resistant Gloves!
customer_reviews.text: First I would like to give a Thank You shout out to "Lostandconfuused" for posting that these gloves run small. I can attest to that because I wear a size six and with the review by "Lostandconfuused" in mind, I ordered the medium and they fit perfectly! They are very well made and thick enough to ward off most thorns. IMHO they are worth every penny I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Runs small / poor fit
customer_reviews.text: These gloves run small and I can not even get my fingers all the wan in and the elastic hits the middle of my hand and is quite uncomfortable. At least buy a size larger , which I did but they are constructed in such a way that the elastic that is supposed to be on your wrist, is actually on the back of your hand. This actually cause me to bruise from wearing the gloves
customer_reviews.author: Singing Pine Tree

customer_reviews.title: Back of glove is mesh, thorns go through!!
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are nice , but insufficient for cutting back a bougainvillea! The back of the hand color part is mesh!!! This isn’t “thorn proof” . This type of plant rips you apart. A fully protected glove is needed. I returned for a complete leather glove .
customer_reviews.author: hapagirl

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: 60+ woman with crepey skin that tears with little to no effort. We are working on the backyard and there is a fine fern that grows full of hook shaped thorns. We worked 3 days in a row and not one drop of blood lost! I love the fact they come up to my elbows but are designed to not inhibit elbow. Medium size was perfect for my hand and the glove itself gives you a lot of dexterity. I was so happy with these, that at the thought of tearing one or some other tragedy I bought an extra pair that is put away. Highly recommend these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Mary S

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these because the last time I worked on thorned bushes my arms got scratches through my long-sleeved shirts. These are great! I had read some people talking about sizing up, but when I saw the price difference between the medium and the large I decided to stick with the medium, and they fit me very well. The quality of the gloves is really nice, and they were tested with several hours of some serious yard work! Mind you, I'm not someone who works daily out in the garden, but these were prefect for me.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this glove based on a previous reviewers images that say it is made in Pakistan on the image. Same brand, same gloves and mine are made in China. I wish companies would be more honest about that so I can avoid purchasing from them. For short notice and the inability to leave the house, they will work.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: can't wear the left glove.
customer_reviews.text: I used these sparingly for about 2 months last fall. Put them away for the winter. Went to dig them out and the left glove is all stiff and I can't even get my fingers into it. I have questioned the company about it, but I have not heard back. I have had a couple other pair of leather rose gloves and this has never happened. Also feel that thorns poke through more readily than my previous gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Pat M

customer_reviews.title: Runs very small. Very rigid materials.
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase it. Good concept; poor execution. The fingers are designed oddly, so even for a petite woman 5' feet, a medium had fingers that were too short. The measurements are off. I would have returned it unused but missed the return cutoff by one day!! very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: P. Lifavi

customer_reviews.title: Very Pretty, Soft Gardening Gloves!
customer_reviews.text: When I first saw them, I thought they looked too wide where they protect your forearm; but they fit perfectly! And they are SO soft with the foam padded palm which is a synthetic leather. And extra padding on the fingers. However, they are just too pretty I'm thinking for what I ordered them for - as long gloves to protect my lower arm when using a small electric chainsaw that has been sitting unused in my garage for several years. It always drips some oil when in use. Might have to just save these for gardening. I haven't used them yet so I just put 4 stars for durability!
customer_reviews.author: Elaine K.

customer_reviews.title: Light duty protection at best
customer_reviews.text: I needed heavy duty protection from heavy duty thorns. These gloves don't quite make the grade. They might work for roses, but not for bigger stuff like brambles and mesquite. The arms are a bit too short, thorns came right through the palms of the gloves. They are compfortable, might be o.k. for lighter duty protection, as in roses, but not sure.
customer_reviews.author: BrandyShew

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves. Does the Job. But Runs Small!
customer_reviews.text: Runs small. I have very small hands but always buy Medium so it’s not fitted and I have room to move. I bought medium in these and my fourth fingers are bumping up against the tip of the glove which has never happened before. But I am really really happy with the quality of the glove, the construction, the material, and how well they work for a major weeding project Ive undertaken. I will probably buy more as these get run down, but will definitely buy Women’s Large. I’ve bought a different pair of goatskin ones just to have an alternate. Will report back on how that goes.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Brady

customer_reviews.title: Excellent protection
customer_reviews.text: These gloves really do provide protection not just for rose thorns, but for a variety of plants or bushes that could do some damage to your hands. My neighbor's "hedges" are like barbed wire. Really nasty. I no longer worry about trimming or moving them them when they encroach into my yard. It sure makes chores easier when you use the right tools and these gloves are tops.
customer_reviews.author: D. H. Vall

customer_reviews.title: Does waste you money
customer_reviews.text: These got a hole in them the first time my wife used them and they did not protect her from rose thorns.They might be okay for pulling weeds, but not much else.
customer_reviews.author: B. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: These are the only rose pruning gloves you will ever need!
customer_reviews.text: I used these gloves to prune roses. The first time I used them I realized how enjoyable rose pruning could be. I never was pricked through the gloves and I could pick up bundles of pruning in my arms easily. I have never pruned roses without getting pricked before. The arms on the gloves are long and cover my arms. There is nothing I do not like about them. I've shared these gloves with friends and relatives who are now dyed-in-the-wool enthusiasts as well. I have never heard a complain from anyone who uses them. Sizing is good; fit a diverse # of people with different size hands.
customer_reviews.author: Cactus lady

customer_reviews.title: Great coverage to avoid poison ivy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves after getting a nasty case of poison ivy from pulling out weeds and brush wearing only short gardening gloves. These long gloves are AWESOME. They are thick enough that I can pull barberry and other thorny shrubs but they are still flexible enough that I can wear them and still have dexterity with handheld tools such as clippers. The materials seems really durable and they fit me very well overall. They're comfortable and even when I'm not doing heavy duty tasks I still enjoy wearing them for everyday gardening/yardwork.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of long garden gloves. They looked a little small at first, but trying them on showed me that I like these gloves how they fit snug, instead of my 'regular' garden gloves that are always over sized. I kind of thought I'd want leather for durability, but if these last a few years I'd be satisfied. They look and feel great and finally I'm not poked when trimming my roses!
customer_reviews.author: Collector Girl

customer_reviews.title: No more scrapes and scratches on my arms!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves and wish I’d thought about finding them sooner. My arms were bruised and scratched after a week of yard work. No mire, however! These gloves come all the way to elbow. Nothing has penetrated them, including my holly bushes. They are thick, and may cause perspiration, but small price to pay! Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Carolina Girl

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are super comfortable. I bought them to protect my arms from ants while I'm weeding. Wrist length gloves invariable allow the little critters to bite my wrists if I don't see them in the dirt right away. They work great. I'm trying to use them sparingly because my last pair of elbow length gloves wore out at the fingers because I wore them so much. (I'm not sure what brand they were.) It's so hot where I live so if I'm wearing short sleeves, they're great for pruning so I don't get scratched. I haven't used them for rose bushes so I'm not sure if they would be adequate for thorns.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durability meets function.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously the best gardening gloves I’ve ever purchased. I usually break through the finger tips of my gloves after wearing them one or two times, not these. My hands usually get all scratched and poked while pruning out thorn bushes, but with these gloves I could straight pull them out without one scratch. These gloves are worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seriously, Size up!
customer_reviews.text: They aren't kidding when the reviews tell you to size up. I thought I had pretty standard medium/smallish sized hands for a woman. I got the medium and had to return them. Even the large are not completely comfortable but I didn't want to send them back a second time. They are otherwise very useful and durable. I think they may be a bit uncomfortable if I have to wear them for a long time as the tips of my fingers are smushed right against the ends of the glove fingers. You may want to consider double sizing up.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Quite protective gloves
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these gloves after my old gauntlet gloves (from 2007) became worn through the finger tips. These older gloves allowed for fine motor dexterity of your fingers but the new ones do not. I suspect that is the trade-off for having reinforced finger tips. These new gloves are strictly for working in thick brush or debris where finger dexterity is not needed. They fit a bit snug but my older pair did as well. That helps to prevent debris from falling down the glove sleeve to your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Grey

customer_reviews.title: Medium was too small
customer_reviews.text: I ordered both AmazonBasics Leather Gardening Gloves with Forearm Protection and Magid Glove & Safety Professional Rose Pruning Thorn Resistant Gardening Gloves. Each was size medium. My expectation was at least one pair would fit. AmazonBasics gloves are better quality but the thumbs were almost an inch too long. Magid were too tight. Both were returned. Ordering these gloves was difficult because no size charts are provided.
customer_reviews.author: Swimmer Girl

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these gloves about two months ago before I realized how much I would love gardening. These gloves are comfortable, and they do protect your forearm from scrapes, etc, but they are not waterproof. Things I do not like about these gloves: Gets dirty easily Not waterproof Does not have any adjustable straps
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Much too small
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a women's small so ordered a size up as recommended. The thumb and forefinger were too small. I returned them for a large, and again, the thumb and forefinger are too small. I have never had this problem with any glove - dress gloves, garden gloves or winter gloves. I will keep the large size, and make do with them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great protection and comfy
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these for 14 months and they’re definitely my favorite. I clear a lot of brush, with every shape thorn, and although they’re not 100% impervious, they are close.... plus (1) they protect my forearms and (2) they’re comfortable to work in for hours. I thought I lost them once and even though I have several other pairs, I was planning to re-purchase these same ones.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Strongly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my mom, she is an avid Gardener and is constantly battling the blackberry bushes that are the back yard. At first she didn't like the idea of her arms being covered, but now these are her absolute favorite gloves, she says they're the best paid she has ever owned. The fit is amazing, it couldn't be more perfect. They're really durable and well made. I just bought a second pair for prime day. Strongly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAllTheThings

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy yard work
customer_reviews.text: I want super impressed with these. My hands were in water, but since they didn’t say water resistant, Zi didn’t get upset when my hands got wet. What was irritating is that they didn’t last long in heavy yard work. There were holes in the index finger of my predominant hands within 2 weeks of daily yard work. I didn’t give them 1 star because I know how hard I am on gloves.
customer_reviews.author: If I’m being honest... 😎

customer_reviews.title: They dont work that well
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves to pull prickly weeds and to trim our barberry bush. They seem to do well with the barberry bush thorns but the thorny weeds totally went through the glove. I'll still keep them because I like having my forearms protected but they are definitely not impenetrable.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are nice and offers great protection for your forearms. The bad thing is the actual glove part. It does NOT protect your hands from thorns. Tiny thorns or thick ones. If you have a garden that is thornless these gloves are for you. If not I would suggest a different pair of garden gloves that also will protect your hands from thorns.
customer_reviews.author: nikki k.

customer_reviews.title: May be good for rose, just not other thorny things
customer_reviews.text: The cactus thorns go right through the gloves. The worst part is, they get stuck when you try to pluck them out and the thorns break leaving part of it still inside the gloves. It is probably ok for rose bushes. I love that it comes all the way to my elbow. But joints have mesh, so you still get poked by rose thorns every now and then.
customer_reviews.author: Pepe

customer_reviews.title: Ladies Thorn Resistant Gardening Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice gloves that protect your hands and forearms when gardening. They are rather thick which prevents you from getting stuck by thorns and branches.
customer_reviews.author: Carol E

customer_reviews.title: These are more for looks and not for use.
customer_reviews.text: The first time I wore these gloves for real gardening, they got a hole in them. The holes that it seemed so it seems like it just wasn't sewed that well. Along with that I kept getting poked through the glove, so this definitely isn't a safety glove or for rose pruning or gardening or anything of that matter. They are cute, but not effective.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: WORST GLOVES EVER FOR CACTUS
customer_reviews.text: The soft fabric that makes these gloves comfortable also attracts and holds glochids, the tiny spines on cactus, such as prickly pear. Even using a light touch as I pruned, I had dozens of spines enter through the gloves and into my skin. There was nothing to do but bag the spine-saturated gloves and throw them away after one use. I am still finding spines on my fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Surdut

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: FYI- The medium-size gloves are very small! I have small, slender hands and have never had an issue with glove sizes- except this time. I'm keeping the gloves, but they're tight! Maybe they'll loosen up a bit.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT GLOVES FOR ROSE CARE
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these gloves for pruning rose bushes. I have climbing roses which are covered in long thorns. The cuffs come to my elbows, so my arms are fully protected. Big thorns do not pierce them, so I am fully protected. They are supple enough for me to attach my roses to the fence without having to remove them. I would heartily recommend them to anyone. I wear size medium gloves, and the fit is good, although they could fit larger or smaller hands. I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, not bulky
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are awesome. I didn't realize they have this sturdy mesh on the sides so that your hands don't get sweaty when you wear them. Wasn't sure if they would be too bulky but they are not. I can grip things easily...even small things. They are very comfortable and have saved me from scratches and poison ivy. I'd buy these again
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: The thumb and index finger are oddly a little short so my finger gets jammed against the seam. On the other hand, I just cut a ton of blackberry vines and have no scratches or broken skin or rashes or anything on my hands and arms. I could feel a few of the thorns, especially when I was tugging on vines to find their ends, but no damage. They do their job well.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Lee

customer_reviews.title: Protect and Attach
customer_reviews.text: Gloves are as advertised, they do protect from thorns, are comfortable, and don't cause you to sweat. There are only 2 downsides: if you are around sticky plants, they will stick to these gloves. Secondly, the sleeves are wide and do not want to fit under shirt sleeves. So, leaves and sticks will fall down the sleeves to your wrists. I would buy these again because they are cost effective--this is my 2nd pair, the first lasted 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great find!
customer_reviews.text: I took the measurement and the chart said to get a medium so I did, hoping they weren’t wrong. Without the chart I would have got the small size and they’d have to be returned. The medium fit great with the perfect amount of wiggle room. I would have hated if they were too snug. I recommend these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Collin

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GLOVES
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of rose bushes and although I have thorn proof garden gloves, they were too short. As I would get into the branches my upper arms were always scratched and cut by the thorns inside the bush. This no longer happens and I am thrilled. I now love working on all my rose bushes. They never looked better and no more cut or scratches. They really are thorn proof and so comfortable I use them for most of my garden work.
customer_reviews.author: CINNA

customer_reviews.title: Best rose gloves ever!!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give these gloves eight stars I would!! They fit perfectly for my hands, which are very small. I ordered a medium for fear a little bit tgat they would be too big. But they fit perfectly for small hands. They go right up to my elbows and they fit over sweatshirt sleeves comfortably. And I ordered a medium for small hands. I often wear a junior large. So if you have bigger hands, so larger than you would
customer_reviews.author: Peter M. Backus

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves! I use to pick blackberries from my wildly grown bush. I have to be careful not to go to deep into the bush because the tops of hands get knicked. Overall this is a great glove and protests the palms and fingers well. I have used for a little over a month but will update after some usage.
customer_reviews.author: Forever Filipina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves fit my small hands perfectly and are fantastic for my needs. I am clearing a garden which I have neglected for 6 years, and it's overgrown with things that have burrs, thorns, and spikes! Ouch! But with these lovely gloves, I tore through the work with nary a scratch!
customer_reviews.author: Dana Gass

customer_reviews.title: Magic Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I like that they come above my elbows. They are comfortable, but when they got wet, I got, I got blisters and calluses in my palm. The finger's tips also tore pretty quickly. I thought maybe I just got a bad batch, so I ordered another pair and same is happening again.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Great for working with prickly plants
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after getting all scratched up doing yardwork. These gloves worked very well, were comfortable, and made it much easier to work with prickly plants, especially pruning rose bushes. I highly recommend them. So far, I've only worn them for a few gardening jobs, so I can't say much about the long term durability yet, but hope these last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa P

customer_reviews.title: NOT thornproof
customer_reviews.text: The sizes run slightly small as other reviewers have mentioned. I returned because the blackberry vines I am clearing have huge needle-like thorns that go right through these gloves, especially if thorns get snagged on the backside of your hand where the glove isn’t as protected. They were great for “non-thorny” garden / yard tasks.
customer_reviews.author: kiki

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and durable.
customer_reviews.text: Had these for several months. No wear and tear at all and haven't been poked thru once from the spikes on pygmy date palms that I trim.
customer_reviews.author: Tam

customer_reviews.title: Works really well.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the gloves to prune very thorny rose brushes. I was tired of getting cut every time I pruned them. I thought that I would take a chance on these. The gloves worked great. They were a little stiff when I first put them on, but after a short while they softened up and worked great. I am really happy that I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Very protective rose gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are thick leather and allow me to deadhead my roses without getting stuck by the thorns. I love the long gauntlet which protects my arms so I can reach through the branches to get at the spent flowers. I can't believe I didn't find these sooner. All the gloves at the nurseries are much lighter weight and not nearly as sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia in NoCO

customer_reviews.title: Not For Prickly Pear Cactus
customer_reviews.text: I got these to plant some prickly pear cactuses. I do not recommend them for this. They were not enough to protect me from the maddening fine prickers. They still ended up lodged in my skin and “polluted” the gloves so they couldn’t be used for other gardening. I’m still in the lion out for cactus appropriate gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Protects my hands and forearms better than most gardening gloves.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are long enough to cover most of my forearms, which are usually punctured and bruised by thistles. The spines still penetrate the leather, not as much as some other gloves. The reduction in damage to my arms is about 75% when used with Kevlar sleeves under the gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Omah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gloves for Working around Plants and Bushes with Thorns
customer_reviews.text: I am always either tearing up my forearms or getting poison ivy on my forearms after poking around in prickly bushes. These gloves have protected me all summer. By this time last year my forearms were all scratched and I had a case of poison ivy. Not so this year!
customer_reviews.author: Mary S.

customer_reviews.title: Gotta get these gloves!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best garden gloves I’ve ever had! Thick durable padded palm and fingers protect from blisters while digging, gardening, sanding, building, and doing all the home improvement projects I love to do. GET THESE GLOVES! I just bought my second pair!
customer_reviews.author: GmaTllamas

customer_reviews.title: Good protection
customer_reviews.text: Was tired of hearing from the lady of the house that she kept getting pricked all over her hands and forearms when pruning/tending to the huge amount of rose bushes she has. Bought her these without her knowledge and had her try them...She loves them! And no more punctures, so she's happy. She especially loves how far they go up the forearm.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE. I have had many gloves that say they will protect you from thorns but these are the best. They are long enough so I can wear short sleeves and still feel confident I am not going to get stuck by a thorn. I love the color (I got the purple) and they have a little grip on the fingers for when I’m pruning or tying down a crawling vine.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan B

customer_reviews.title: Best gardening gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love rose garden gloves for regular gardening! Protection for your arms as well as hands! No dirt can fall down gloves like short gloves. I will never use short gloves again. I have purchased leather ones also that I love but the are twice the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Grand parents

customer_reviews.title: Fits to size. Great product. Made well.
customer_reviews.text: These fit exactly as expected. I've always been a medium in latex gloves... or a small if I wanted them super tight. I bought medium and they are perfect. Not too snug. Not too lose. I still have full dexterity but my hand and arms are completely covered and safe from thorns, bugs, snakes, poison ivy etc. Would def recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Acecondley

customer_reviews.title: They Work and Not Just for Roses
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are perfect not only for roses, but reaching back into areas of questionable "brush" while gardening. They are practicably unpenetrable by thorns, even the glove part. They are not bulky at all and surprisingly relatively cool. I use them daily for various kinds of yard work.
customer_reviews.author: Backyard Images

customer_reviews.title: These work great!
customer_reviews.text: These are really cute for gardening gloves. I wish I had gotten a large because the medium is a little tight but it’s still comfortable. I’m always scared to grab the really thorny weeds. I went right for them with these on and I am so happy to say these are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Jennbug25

customer_reviews.title: Great garden gloves
customer_reviews.text: Best garden gloves ever! Great protection when dealing with prickly plants and tall weeds. The leather finger/hand part is very soft and allows ease of hand movement. Bending fingers is easy with these soft but sturdy gloves. The forearm protection is longer than other gloves of this type. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Sensible gardening gloves
customer_reviews.text: I brought these gloves to deadhead knock-out roses, makes the roses exploded back out in no time, giving my yard continuous color (never thought I'd have roses in my landscape). I prune and deadhead quick and efficiently with these bad boys. I also bought them to protect me from poison ivy when weeding the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: A good garden glove
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great for working in my yard. I have lots of rose bushes and other plants that need pruning. These gloves protect my hands and arms well - no sticks from rose thorns. They are not as expensive as the first pair I purchased but seemed to work just as well. They do make my hands sweat, but I think that is to be expected in our hit climate. They fit my hands pretty well and I have small hands. I would definitely recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth M. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: A must have for pain free rose pruning
customer_reviews.text: Awesome gloves, my roses are beautiful but have some vicious thorns. These gloves allow me to trim, pick, and prune without getting stuck. A big thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Krickett  Filburn

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves
customer_reviews.text: I just received the gloves and they seem well made. I ordered a medium and the fingers are barely long enough and I don't have long nails. I bought these in an attempt protect my arms from poison ivy/oak. Wish the sleeves were a bit longer so they would come up to my elbows but the length is adequate. All in all, very pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for work with Cacti
customer_reviews.text: I was so hopeful that these gloves would be the ticket to not getting so many thorns when weeding my cacti. Wrong. The thorns go through the gloves to lodge in my fingers as well as sticking in the gloves to poke me again later. I have tried using them for general gardening, but they are too stiff and awkward. They are sturdy and thick, but just don't protect my hands and fingers from those darn cactus thorns. I wouldn't buy again, but may recommend depending on the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Kristyn Tickler

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these garden gloves!
customer_reviews.text: The garden gloves were only recently delivered and I used them for the first time today weeding and pulling out some thorny vines. The thorns did not penetrate the gloves and my arms were not covered in scratches when I was done.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Gift for Mom's Gardening
customer_reviews.text: Mom loves these gloves. She does gardening with her rose bushes & other prickly plants and always comes in the house with cuts. My friend recommended these gloves for their sturdiness and length. My mom thanks me continuously!
customer_reviews.author: Carol S

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the stikers away!
customer_reviews.text: Lost one of my gardening gloves so bought these. I have roses, but also have thorns grown up in azaleas due to physical inability to prune them out often enough. These long gloves keep me protected from rose thorns and thorn vines. Win-win situation.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Ramey Hill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality protecting hands and arms.
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves. So comfortable and provide great protection. I use them primarily for working with barbed wire fence. They are good for all gardening and lawn work. They have a really good grip and keep your hands from getting scratched. Good protection from Florida bugs and other varmits (snakes). Will buy again as needed. Excellent workmanship. The seams are holding up well with much use.
customer_reviews.author: Taxed Genie

customer_reviews.title: Poison ivy? Not today!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for some longer gloves to wear while doing some landscaping. These are a nice fit. I wash them after each use because of the potential poison ivy that I can’t seem to kill. They’ve held up nicely! I should probably buy some more.
customer_reviews.author: jess p

customer_reviews.title: Small/oddly shaped, generally decent
customer_reviews.text: I did already forget which size I bought, so it might just be the wrong size, but these gloves are too small for me. It also seems a bit weird that the fingers are such an even length, but maybe that only stood out to me because they're small. I don't garden for very long each day (maybe 10 mins) so I'm going to keep using them anyway, especially since they're otherwise decent gloves. I rinse them off each day so I can store them inside, and I haven't yet seen any signs of water damage
customer_reviews.author: Gwendolyn Kress

customer_reviews.title: Great Gardening Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Just right for working on Rose's and thorny bushes. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Deno

customer_reviews.title: Saves me from poison ivy and mosquitoes
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these gloves, comfortable and easy to do yard work in. Got the worst case of poison ivy recently and now wear long sleeves and these gloves. No more poison ivy! And as a bonus, no mosquito bites either.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for pulling picker weeds straight out of the ground, removing raspberry bushes, and for trimming rose bushes. A few pokes here and there, but that did not prevent me from doing a full week of yard work. So much better than regular garden gloves with plastic fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Prickers go through- like butter!
customer_reviews.text: Literally, I reached for the pricker weed I wanted to pull, and the pricker went right through. Tried again and same time. Totally worthless!
customer_reviews.author: Peabody1

customer_reviews.title: I really love these gloves
customer_reviews.text: I really love these gloves. They come nearly to the elbow and keeps me from getting mosquito bites. You can get them wet without a problem but they only last about six months. After that time I noticed little holes at the tips of my fingers. Other than that, I really like these gloves. Six months is not very long but I have actually purchased these gloves for the third time because they're comfortable and effective
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: The Best!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got theses for my girlfriend, I had gotten a different pair and LOVED them. My girlfriend seen them, tried them, LOVED THEM, I bought her a pair of these, she tells me EVERY TIME she uses them how much she loves them.Cant live without them for cleaning out the roses, pruning, ect!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Baxter

customer_reviews.title: My favorite!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought several pairs of these gloves over the years for myself and my mom. We both garden a lot and have many rose bushes. These gloves have saved my arms from scratches and pricks from pruning trees and working in the roses. I wear them every time I garden. I’ve used other types of gauntlet style gloves but I’ve found these are my favorite!
customer_reviews.author: Apple T.

customer_reviews.title: Covers forearms well.
customer_reviews.text: These are nice gloves. I’ve used them to clear out dead blackberry vines. Once in a while a thorn goes through one of the fingers or the palm area, but other than that, they’ve been protective. I gave it four, rather than five stars as they seem to run a little smaller than the size would suggest.
customer_reviews.author: Jeamic

customer_reviews.title: These run small
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I gave them a 3 star is they were too small and I have to send them back. I am reordering them in a large. I liked the feel, quality, padding, etc..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not made for tall people.
customer_reviews.text: I am a 5'9, 145 lb female. The glove portion is too small as the elastic wrist band is in the palm of my hand and the "extra forearm protection" does not even go half way up my forearm. I purchased Jardineer Thornproof Gardening Gloves instead and these truly fit like a glove ;)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I like these gloves, they are very strong and protect the arms. The only thing is they don’t stretch so make sure the fit is correct, there is a great guide to help you get the fit right.
customer_reviews.author: Jolynn

customer_reviews.title: Youch!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these for 6 years, so they are pretty durable. I love that they are long and give you some protection, but I still get pricked in the fingers with thorns every time I use them. Now, maybe you won’t have a thorn embedded in your skin, like you would without, but they are still going to get you right through the fingers of these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: The G's

customer_reviews.title: Great gardening gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Love these for trimming rose bushes. I am also allergic to poison ivy so these help to keep it off my arms. Would recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: L. Tipton

customer_reviews.title: Don't Bother
customer_reviews.text: Took me about 40 minutes to destroy the fingers on these. Not thorn proof at all. Cute but very thin soft material- not leather. Had to put gloves under these gloves just for cutting blackberries. Will not hold up.
customer_reviews.author: marie

customer_reviews.title: Tore after second use
customer_reviews.text: Used these gloves twice and the finger tip on the index finger just tore when pruning. Made with low quality materials that felt cheap and that made your hands/arms incredibly sweaty.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Pavlovich

customer_reviews.title: I love these gloves
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves. l They are long and sturdy. They are sturdy enough for vines and other things to not get through. If I get poisen Ivy, I get it above the gloves, and that is not often. I cannot find these gloves anywhere else except on Amazon. Please keep them. They also have reinforced fingers for weeding. Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Ngirilover

customer_reviews.title: Runs very small
customer_reviews.text: Believe the reviews that say they run small. I don’t have big hands at all but the elastic part that’s supposed to be around your wrist doesn’t reach my wrist making them very uncomfortable and always sliding off.
customer_reviews.author: N. Reardon

customer_reviews.title: Best buy ever!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, so happy, a beautifully stitched, well made pair of Pro Garden Gloves. Fits perfectly with enough give to expand or contract around your hand for a great fit due to elastic within the hand area. The protection of these fine gloves has allowed me to move roses and bougainvilleas without any thorns scratching my skin. A nice long arm length protects me entirely. VERY well made and a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: carolineTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Too small and made in China
customer_reviews.text: Too small. I always fit a medium glove and this is too small. So it's uncomfortable. There is no give either so it makes it uncomfortable. It is made in China, maybe that's why it's so small
customer_reviews.author: Shops2

customer_reviews.title: Best gloves I've owned.
customer_reviews.text: They work great against all but the worst thorns, but really what gloves can protect against everything? These fit great, and I can comfortably work in my yard without having to worry about what I grab. Avoid grabbing fully established blackberries and these will work great.
customer_reviews.author: DabbinRose

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gloves!
customer_reviews.text: These are sooo great! I have bought 3 or 4 pairs so far and they are wonderful. I use them for all of my gardening, not just when I'm working with thorny plants. The fingertips do wear out first for me but that's probably because I use them for everything including digging. Really great gloves though.
customer_reviews.author: Lele Blavis

customer_reviews.title: Love these gloves
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a pair of the Rose Pruning Thorn Resistant Gardening Gloves with Long Forearm and love them! I'm allergic to the thorns of my palms as my hands and fingers wuld swell when I got the least little prick. NO MORE THORN Injuries!
customer_reviews.author: Cherbear

customer_reviews.title: Protection from thorns.
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to prune my out of control and massive rose bush with just a pair of cotton garden gloves. I get stabbed repeatedly by the thorns. These gloves are what the doctor ordered. I love them. :)
customer_reviews.author: Nonie P.

product_meta.title: Magid Glove & Safety Professional Rose Pruning Thorn Resistant Gardening Gloves with Long Forearm Protection for Women (BE195TM) - Puncture Resistant, Medium (1 Pair)
product_meta.description:
Color:Tan & Purple| Size:1 Pair| Style:Women's Medium

Bella gloves offer serious thorn protection, cultivated with everyone in mind. With a puncture-resistant, synthetic leather padded palm and reinforced fingertips, this rose glove provides what professional rose gardeners need most - strength, durability and comfort. The elbow-length gauntlet cuff protects forearms from cuts and scratches. A knuckle guard gives added protection from thorny plants. Whimsical printed floral fingertips add extra grip. Form-fitting spandex back for maximum comfort. Women's size medium.

Magid Glove & Safety is America’s leading manufacturer, importer, and distributor of work gloves and personal protective equipment (PPE), including first aid products and protective and disposable clothing. In today's rapidly changing work environment, product demands continue to evolve, requiring safety manufacturers to grow with the challenge. MAGID stays ahead of the curve by anticipating market needs and developing innovative products. Our dedication to this and our strong work ethic are reasons why customers choose MAGID as their PPE partner.

Our mechanics gloves take the punishment so your hands don’t. Made out of synthetic material, our gloves offer great dexterity and grip, while still maintaining maximum comfort, durability and protection. For extra protection depending on your line of work, you may also be interested in our selection of chemical resistant gloves. Buy wholesale mechanic gloves today from Magid Glove & Safety! Your hands will be thanking you.
feature_bullets: Puncture resistant padded palm and reinforced fingertips
Knuckle guard gives added protection from thorns
Form fitting spandex back for comfort and flexibility
Whimsical printed floral fingertips for added grip

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
